attributes.action: Make the nhs routinely screen for GBS
attributes.additional_details: Screening for GBS is not recommended by the UK National Screening Committee nor the Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists .An antenatal screening program, using tests specifically designed to detect group B Strep carriage, would identify more women whose babies are at increased risk of GBS infection than using risk factors alone.  Research shows that as a result of these additional cases being prevented, this could save the government an estimated £37 million per year.
